markers.address: N/A (private home)
markers.description: Home baked bread and buns, made using stoneground organic wheat, spelt, & rye flours. Limited delivery service to the south west area of Sheffield. Bread is baked to order, so to ensure your loaf please contact Mick Saxton by 4:00pm the day before baking. Also runs baking classes.
markers.title: Saxton's Home Bakery

markers.address: Whirlow Hall Farm Trust, Whirlow Lane, Sheffield S11 9QF
markers.description: Working farm run by an educational trust offering daily or residential visits to children. Has a farm shop and cafe using food produced by the farm and other local suppliers. Also offers pick your own fruit and veg.
markers.opening: Farm shop, Wednesday - Sunday and Bank Holidays 10.00am - 5.00pm; Café  10.00am - 3.00pm for Full Menu and 3.00 - 4.30pm for drinks and cakes
markers.title: Whirlow Hall Farm Shop & Cafe

markers.address: The Schoolrooms, Mill Lee Road, Low Bradfield, Sheffield, S6 6LB
markers.description: A butchery-deli-café in Sheffield producing, selling and serving its own produce and that of other sustainable local suppliers within the Sheffield and Yorkshire area. The School Rooms produces its own lamb and eggs on the farm, and stocks all locally produced beef, chicken, pork, honey, beer, jams & preserves, breaqd, pies and cheeses.
markers.opening: Thursday 10.00am - 4.00pm; Friday 10.00am - 8.00pm; Saturday 9.00am - 8.00pm; Sundays and bank holidays 9.00am - 5.00pm
markers.title: The School Rooms

markers.address: The Chatsworth Farm Shop, Pilsley, Bakewell, Derbyshire, DE45 1UF
markers.description: Farm shop and restaurant. Offers quality produce fresh from the estate, tenant farms, Derbyshire suppliers and small food producers. Farm shop includes home-cooked meats and pies from the delicatessen counter, and a bakery providing fresh bread and cakes. The restaurant chefs create seasonal recipes using as much local produce from the farm shop as possible.
markers.keywords: red meat, poultry, bread, home baking
markers.opening: Shop: Monday-Saturday, 9.00am - 5.30pm; Sunday, 11.00am - 5.00pm. Restaurant: Monday-Saturday, 9.00am - 5.00pm; Sunday, 10.00am - 5.00pm.
markers.title: Chatsworth farm shop

markers.address: 253 Baslow Road, Sheffield, S17 4DU
markers.description: Farm shop offering fresh home made local produce. Beef comes from Broadstorth farm in Dore. Pies, speciality dishes, etc., are prepared in own kitchens. Also offer outside catering and home delivery services.
markers.title: Liberty Food Farm Shop

markers.address: 3 Market Street, Bakewell, Derbyshire, DE45 1HG
markers.description: The Original Farmers’ Market Shop is a small, independent business offering a range of high quality local and British produce. The shop operates on the Farmers’ Market rules, aiming to source as much as possible within a 30 mile radius of the shop. Goods are source from further afield if there is no suitable local producer. Online orders also available.

Sources ingredients from a maximum 15 mile radius; uses seasonal produce as much as possible. Make their own chutneys, jams, pickles and sauces, and smoke meats and cheeses on site. Work with the Carbon Trust to reduce carbon footprint. Children welcome until 9.30pm.
markers.opening: Monday - Friday, 12.00pm – 11.30 pm; Saturday - Sunday, 10.00 am – 12.30 am
markers.title: The York

markers.address: 49-51 Commonside, Sheffield S10 1GF
markers.description: Thornbridge pub serving cask ales from Thornbridge’s range are on tap, alongside quality lagers and an extensive variety of bottled beers selected by the brewers. Wines by John Mitchells, Sheffield’s premier wine shop and Coffee by Sheffield roaster Pollards are also available. Regular quiz nights and entertainment as well as being the only Sheffield pub with full size snooker room and table.
markers.opening: Monday - Wednesday, 4.00pm - 11.30pm; Thursday 12.00pm - 11.30pm; Friday - Saturday 12.00pm - 12.30am; Sunday 12.00pm - 11.30pm
markers.title: The Hallamshire House

markers.address: Greystones Road, Sheffield S11 7BS
markers.description: Thornbridge pub serving cask ales from Thornbridge’s range are on tap, alongside quality lagers and an extensive variety of bottled beers selected by the brewers. Wines by John Mitchells, Sheffield’s premier wine shop and Coffee by Sheffield roaster Pollards are also available. Bar snacks menu of pies and sandwiches available, involving some local produce. Regular live music in back room.
markers.opening: Sunday - Thursday, 12.00pm - 11.00pm; Friday - Saturday 12.00pm - 11.30pm. Food daily, 12.00pm - 6.00pm
markers.title: The Greystones

markers._d180g: Used to be Eight Ounce - now re-branded and needs re-checking
markers.address: 355 Glossop Road, Sheffield S10 2HP
markers.description: Artisan coffee house. Coffee beans by Workshop, Square Mile, James Gourmet & Origin. Tea leaves by Canton.
markers.title: Upshot Espresso

markers.address: Sheffield Road, Dronfield S18 2GD
markers.description: A friendly pub on Sheffield Road in Dronfield, situated in front of the world’s oldest football club, Sheffield FC. The five handpulls on the bar serve locally brewed Thornbridge beers plus a rotating guest beer. Food menu includes some locally sourced ingredients; roast on Sundays.
markers.opening: Pub: Monday - Thursday, 3.30pm - 11.00pm; Friday - Saturday 12.00pm - 12.00am; Sunday 12.00pm - 10.30pm. Food: Wednesday, 5.00pm - 8.00pm, Thursday - Friday, 12.00pm - 2.00pm & 5.00pm - 8.00pm, Saturday 12.00pm - 7.00pm, Sunday 12.00pm - 4.00pm
markers.title: The Coach and Horses

markers.address: Derbyshire Lane, Sheffield S8 9EQ
markers.description: Newly refurbished pub taken on by Thornbridge Brewery, featuring a range of beers including Thornbridge cask ales. Bar snacks available every day.
markers.opening: Pub: Monday - Wednesday, 4.00pm - 11.00pm; Friday - Saturday, 12.00pm - 12.00am; Thursday & Sunday, 12.00pm - 11.00pm. Food: Monday - Wednesday, 4.00pm - 8.00pm; Thursday - Sunday, 12.00pm - 7.00pm
markers.title: The Cross Scythes

markers.address: Bank St Arts, 32-40 Bank St, Sheffield S1 2DS
markers.description: The Rude Shipyard co-operative have taken on the cafe at Bank St Arts, providing leaf teas, Pollards coffee, snacks and lunches. Their lunch menu includes soup, sandwiches, sweet and savoury crepes, hotpot of the day, flatbreads salads and more.
markers.title: To The Lighthouse

markers._d180g: Need to find out opening hours
markers.address: 985 Ecclesall Road, Banner Cross, Sheffield S11 8TN
markers.description: Café and delicatessen sourcing fresh local (where possible) seasonal ingredients. Their lunch and early dinner menu includes hot and cold daily specials, Ploughman’s and Deli platters, Homemade Tarts and Pizza breads, Fresh Soups and a Sandwich menu.
markers.title: Snap Deli

markers.address: Trippet Lane, Sheffield S1 4EL
markers.description: One of the small chain of pubs owned by the Thornbridge brewery, Dada is located in the former Trippet's Wine Bar. It features a regularly changing list of Thornbridge beers on cask and keg, plus a number of world classic beers. Wines by John Mitchells in Sheffield and Coffee by Sheffield roaster Pollards are also available.
markers.title: Dada Bar

markers.address: 2–3 York Street, Sheffield S1 2ER
markers.description: Eten cooks hearty meals with quality local and seasonal ingredients to eat in or take away.
markers.title: Eten

markers.address: 90 Arundel Street, Sheffield S1 4RE
markers.description: Café offering Mexican street food including burritos, tacos, nachos and quesadilla, using locally sourced ingredients, such as Moss Valley Fine Meats. Also selling desserts, including Our Cow Molly's ice-cream.
markers.title: Street Food Chef - Mexican Canteen (Arundel Street)

markers.address: 98 Pinstone Street, Sheffield S1 2HQ
markers.description: Café offering Mexican street food including burritos, tacos, nachos and quesadilla, using locally sourced ingredients, such as Moss Valley Fine Meats. Also selling desserts, including Our Cow Molly's ice-cream.
markers.title: Street Food Chef - Burrito Bar (Pinstone Street)

markers.address: Lower Foyer, Crucible Theatre, Norfolk Street, Sheffield S1 2LA
markers.description: City centre café offering pastries, cakes, traybakes, hot dishes and salads using the finest ingredients available or are supplied from local producers who agree that sustainability and quality are important.
markers.opening: Monday - Saturday: 10am - theatre closing, or to 6pm on non-performance days.
markers.title: Café Crucible

markers._d180g: Opening times not on website, need checking
markers.address: Rustlings Road, Sheffield S11 7AB
markers.description: Café based in the middle of Endcliffe Park offering cooked breakfasts, traditional English lunches and dinner time snacks. Uses locally sourced foods and fair trade tea and coffees.
markers.title: Endcliffe Park Café

markers.address: 72 John Street, Sheffield S2 4QU
markers.description: Aiming to provide great value for money with their range of ‘workers sandwiches’ and specials, Harland Café offers hearty and wholesome food cooked and baked on the premises using simple recipes and fresh produce. The café can be hired for a range of occasions including children’s parties and weddings.
markers.title: Harland Café

markers.address: 501a Glossop Road, Broomhill, Sheffield S10 2QE
markers.description: Locally owned cafe/bistro using local produce, inc. meat from Moss Valley, S10 & Roneys, free range eggs, fair trade tea, Heavenly Coffee, baked goods from Roses, Turners, Sheffield Country Market, The Cupcake Makers, and Bradfield beer. Aims to minimise food miles by buying from local growers & foragers. 90% of Bistro menu can be adapted for gluten-free diets.
markers.opening: Cafe: Monday - Saturday, 8.30am - 5.00pm; Sunday, 10.00am - 4.30pm. Bistro: Thursday - Saturday, 6.00pm till late.
markers.title: Vittles

markers.address: LEAF Community Allotments Project, Norwood Allotments, Herries Road, Sheffield S5 7HA. Pedestrian Entrance opposite Burrows Drive
markers.description: LEAF is a local food growing project that runs several allotment plots so that local people can learn to grown and prepare their own fresh food. The group run weekly, open-to-all volunteer session, where people can learn about sustainable and organic production, composting on-site and food preparation. Enquiries from new volunteers are always welcome.
markers.opening: Regular volunteer sessions: Wednesday 1.00pm – 6.00pm; Thursday 10.00am – 1.00pm; Saturday 10.00am – 6.00pm
markers.title: Local Enterprise Around Food (LEAF)

markers.address: Infield Lane, Sheffield S9
markers.description: A community allotment based within the Infield Lane Allotment site, with a large polytunnel, 6 raised beds and 12 fruit trees. Available to community groups on application.
markers.title: Infield Lane Allotments

markers.address: Meetings held at: Quaker Meeting House, 10 St James Street, Sheffield S1 2EW
markers.description: District organisation of the National Society of Allotment and Leisure Gardeners. The federation provides advice and promotes allotment gardening.  An allotment competition is traditionally held in July. Holds 5 indoor meetings per year, usually 3rd Monday in the month.  Also holds outdoor meetings during the summer.  Please contact for details
markers.title: Sheffield Allotments and Leisure Gardeners Federation

markers.address: No 11, Meersbrook Allotments, Meersbrook Road, Sheffield S8 9HU
markers.description: Visually Impaired Gardeners are a voluntary gardening group with an allotment for visually impaired people (guide dogs included). Meets at Meersbrook Allotments, Thursdays at 10.00am
markers.title: Visually Impaired Gardeners and Allotments (VIGA)

markers.address: Brook Road, Meersbrook, Sheffield S8
markers.description: Meersbrook Walled Garden includes vegetable, soft fruit and herb growing areas, a Japanese-style garden, an orchard, a polytunnel and greenhouses, with regular volunteering days and weekend events. The Ecominds project for people with mental health difficulties are also based at the garden.
markers.title: Meersbrook Park Walled Garden

markers.address: Behind Centre in the Park, Norfolk Park, Sheffield S2 2PN
markers.description: This 1 acre community garden includes a large polytunnel and a newly planted orchard and offers volunteers an excellent opportunity to be involved with the development of a community garden from its early beginnings.
markers.keywords: orchard, fruit and vegetables, education, community
markers.title: Norfolk Park Community Garden

markers.address: Vickers Drive, Sheffield S5 6TG
markers.description: A community allotment run in partnership with Heeley City Farm and Sure Start, providing an opportunity for locals to have a go at growing food and flowers, interact with nature and learn about healthy eating. Regular activities include: beginners gardening courses, Volunteer sessions (adults only), Toddler Time and After School Time.
markers.title: Firth Park Community Allotment

markers.address: Empire Road, Nether Edge, Sheffield S7 1GN
markers.description: A community garden providing space for members of the local community to come together to learn about growing fruit and vegetables and eat the produce. No gardening experience necessary, everyone welcome.
markers.title: Common Ground Community Garden

markers.address: Infield Lane, Sheffield S9
markers.description: Meeting at Infield Lane Allotment site, this community allotment encourages local community members to take part in growing, maintenance & harvesting sessions held at the allotment. The site includes a large polytunnel, raised beds and an orchard providing organic growing opportunities for all ages.
markers.title: Darnall Allotment Project (Infield Lane)

markers.address: Richards Road, Sheffield S2 3DT
markers.description: Heeley City Farm offers weekly volunteer sessions to help maintain the small vegetable, fruit and herb garden located on-site at Heeley City Farm. Produce from the garden helps to supply the farm café.
markers.title: Heeley City Farm Kitchen Garden

markers.address: Stanley Road, Sheffield S36 2FQ
markers.description: Stocksbridge Community Gardens Group helps new gardeners develop their skills. The group holds a community allotment with greenhouse which is open to anyone with an interest in gardening. The group occasionally works with local schools at the allotment/community garden. All members share the produce grown. Facilities are all wheelchair accessible.
markers.title: Stocksbridge Community Gardens Group

markers.address: 120-126 Bawtry Road, Sheffield S9 1UE
markers.description: Tinsley Community Allotment is an organic community allotment including a small forest garden, polytunnel and raised beds. Managed by Tinsley Tree Project, who organises weekly volunteer sessions to help with garden maintenance and the growing and harvesting of fruit and vegetables. Volunteers may be entitled to travel expenses.
markers.title: Tinsley Community Allotment

markers.address: 14 Woodbank Crescent, Sheffield S8 9EE
markers.description: Woodbank Crescent Community Garden is a voluntary group which has worked to establish a community garden on a patch of abandoned land between Woodbank Crescent and Chesterfield Road.
markers.title: Woodbank Crescent Community Garden

markers.address: Sheffield
markers.description: SAGE (Support Arts Gardening Education) promotes the mental and physical well-being of adults experiencing mental health problems via a horticultural therapy project based on Grimesthorpe allotments, and other therapeutic projects such as singing workshops, art and craft sessions and food growing courses.
markers.opening: Run 4 sessions per week. Information on being referred to the project available on the website.
markers.title: SAGE Greenfingers

markers.address: Abbeyfield Park, Abbeyfield Road, Burngreave, Sheffield S4 7AT
markers.description: Green City Action run projects to improve the environment in Burngreave. The School for Vegetables project offers support for those wanting to grow their own food, including school groups, volunteers and local residents. Also offers a tool bank service.
markers.opening: School for Veg: Call in at Grimesthorpe Rd allotments, plots 3 and 4, on Thursday mornings between 10.00am and 1.00pm; Tool Bank: Saturdays 10.00am – 12.00pm, Thursdays 12.00pm – 2.00pm
markers.title: Green City Action

markers.address: off Martin Street, Sheffield S6 3DT
markers.description: Apples, hazels, blackcurrants, blackberries, gooseberries, plums. Originally planted in 1990 by the Ponderosa Environmental Group.
markers.title: Ponderosa community orchard.

markers.address: Parkwood Springs, closest entrances to community garden are from Rutland Road or Cooks Wood Road - see map at http://www.parkwood-springs.btck.co.uk/FindingParkwoodSprings.
markers.description: A  unique garden in Sheffield - possibly the only true forest garden in the city planted with the help of Edible Cities in Leeds. Located in the centre of Parkwood Springs at crest of hill very close to ski slope - a mountain bike path runs alongside. You'll find: blackcurrants and whitecurrants in July, mulberries in August and apples and pears in Sept/Oct.
markers.title: Parkwood Springs forest garden

markers.address: Abbeydale Road, S7 2BA. Between Lowes wallpaper shop and the hand car wash.
markers.description: Small parcel of mostly wooded sloping land planted as an initial level of a forest garden in 2010 by Sheffield City Council, Abundance and Abbeydale Communities Together (ACT). Make your way through the brambles and you can find blackcurrants cherries (July); plums (August); quince and hazels (Sept/Oct).
markers.title: Lowes Community Garden

markers.address: Hagg Hill, off Rivelin Valley Road
markers.description: A small cooperative running a community allotment garden ("Lotti") growing food to share amongst the members, most of whom are in or near the Rivelin Valley. Grows crops as organically and sustainably as possible.
markers.title: Hillside Harvest

markers.address: Robin Lane, Sheffield S20 1BD
markers.description: Community orchard owned by Sheffield City Council, and managed in partnership with the Sheffield Lanscape Trust and Beighton Environment Group. Located off Robin Lane, near the Methodist Chapel, walk down a public path to metal gates and on the left is the orchard entrance.
markers.opening: Hosts an apple day in October.
markers.title: Beighton Orchard

markers.address: The Old Rectory, 402b Handsworth Road, Sheffield S13 9BZ
markers.description: A project to transform the old kitchen gardens at the back of the Old Rectory into a new gardening project, offering people the chance to learn about growing their own veg and taking produce home. The area is being designed with raised beds for better disabled access.
markers.opening: From May to October, on site every 4th Sunday 10.00am - 2.00pm. Just call in - no need to book
markers.title: The Old Rectory Jubilee Community Garden

markers.address: c/o Mount Tabor Methodist Church. Wordsworth Avenue. Sheffield. S5 8NJ
markers.description: PXI is a Methodist Church project in Parson Cross. It runs Space to Grow sessions for people who find gardening and being outdoors a good way of helping them feel and be healthier. They run sessions at The Cross at Yew Lane, and Parson Cross Park Allotments – Plot 107, as well as in conjunction with LEAF at Norwood Road allotments (plot 64).
markers.opening: Session times vary by location - check website or contact for details.
markers.title: PXI - Space to Grow

markers.address: Room 3G11, Fulwood House, 5 Old Fulwood Road, Sheffield S10 3TH
markers.description: A social enterprise developed out of the health service, Recovery Enterprises develops enterprises whch will benefit people with mental health problems. They have developed a community allotment in Fulwood and Oasis Gardening Services which can help revamp allotment plots and private gardens.
markers.title: Recovery Enterprises

markers.address: Greave House Farm, New Hall Lane, Sheffield S36 4GH
markers.description: A small-holding providing therapeutic meaningful work activities for vulnerable people with learning disabilities and / or mental health problems. The “Day Workers” pay £40 per day and can grow fruit and vegetables, and look after chickens and raise animals. Activities are informed by permaculture design principles and the challenge of living a simple, low impact lifestyle.
markers.opening: Day worker sessions are on Mondays. Contact the Trust to arrange a visit.
markers.title: Greave House Farm Trust

markers.address: 120 Gell Street, Sheffield S3 7QW
markers.description: Work with schools, communities, surgeries, libraries and lots of other organisations to create instant allotments. Garden Gorilla can supply all the containers, soil, seeds and even some tools to get you going, and will organise an expert to help you get the best from your new food garden.
markers.opening: Contact Garden Gorilla to see if they are in your area yet.
markers.title: Garden Gorilla

markers.address: Trade Base Allotment, Windmill Lane, Sheffield S5 6FA
markers.description: Community Allotment project, and a provider for Self Directed Support for those on an individual budget for health and social care needs.
markers.opening: 4 morning sessions each week on Monday, Wednesday, Thursday (all 9.30am start) and Saturday (10.00am).
markers.title: Trade Base Allotment Project

markers.address: Attercliffe Cemetery, Attercliffe Rd, Sheffield
markers.description: A number of big, old cherry trees planted in the cemetery just off Attercliffe Common. The trees fruit slightly sporadically but when they do, they produce the tastiest, juiciest cherries in July.
markers.title: Attercliffe Cemetery cherry trees

markers.address: Ellesmere Green, top of Spital Hill, Sheffield
markers.description: A number of very large, old cherry trees fruiting in July/August. The best fruits are small and dark and very tasty.
markers.title: Ellesmere Green Cherry Trees

markers.address: Industry Street, Walkley, Sheffield
markers.description: Two large, lovely trees on the side of the road, bearing small and sour cherries in July/August. A few of the cherries are accessible from the ground, most need equipment or climbing skills.
markers.title: Industry Street Cherry Trees

markers.address: Blake St, Sheffield
markers.description: Tiny forest garden comprised of various wildflowers and rasp/blackberries, young cherry and apple trees, currants, etc.
markers.title: Blake Street Nature Park

markers.address: Back end of Waitrose car park off Napier St, Sheffield
markers.description: Two Juneberry trees. The fruits are sweet small and dark blue/purple when ripe. Look similar to blueberries. Mature around beginning of July.
markers.title: Waitrose Car Park Juneberry Trees

markers.address: On corner of Fentonville Rd and Sharrow Lane
markers.description: An unlikely place for a community garden but you'll find rich pickings here, including blackcurrants & gooseberries in July, and apples & grapes in September.
markers.title: Fentonville Savannah

markers.address: Sheffield General Cemetery, access via Cemetery Road or Stalker Lees Road
markers.description: A number of fairly young fruit trees including apples, pears, cherries and plums.
markers.title: Sheffield General Cemetery Fruit Trees

markers.address: Corner of Goodwin Rd and Thirwell Rd. Forms part of Heeley Millennium Park.
markers.description: A relatively recent community garden planted by Heeley Development Trust. What you'll find: gooseberries, jostaberries, currants (July); raspberries (August); raspberries, apples (September)
markers.title: Heeley Community Garden

markers.address: Island between Blackstock and Gleadless Roads.
markers.description: Remnants of an old orchard just off a busy road, with lovely russety apples and pears in Oct/Nov. There is easy access to trees but access to fruit may prove difficult due to their height.
markers.title: Old Gleadless Valley Orchard

markers.address: Off Blackstock Road, Gleadless Valley.
markers.description: Remnants of old orchard amidst the woods. You can find cooking apples, crab apples and damsons from Sept-Nov. Fairly difficult to locate, and access can be tricky due to nettles, etc.
markers.title: Old Lees Hall Orchard

markers.address: Trans Pennine Trail alongside Ecclesfield Road, between Fife St and Deep Lane
markers.description: Wild garlic grows alongside the brook accessed via the section of the Trans Pennine Trail running parallel to Ecclesfield Road.
markers.title: Blackburn Brook Wild Garlic

markers.address: Whiteley Woods between Whiteley Wood Road and Ivy Cottage Lane
markers.description: Wild garlic grows alongside the Porter Brook accessed off the well-used path through the woods.
markers.title: Whiteley Woods Wild Garlic

markers._d180g: havent been there yet
markers.address: Long Ln, Sheffield, S10 5PY
markers.description: Creating meadows, orchards and vegetable cultivation spaces for people to grow together using sustainable, organic principles based on Permaculture on this 3 acre field on the northern slopes of the Rivelin Valley. Visitors welcome, whether just for a look around, to give a few hours help, or to get involved in a longer term project.
markers.opening: On site one or two days per week - check the Facebook page.
markers.title: Holly Hagg

markers._d180g: title may change- not sure what they want to call themselves!
markers.address: Oakholme Road Sheffield, S10. (http://goo.gl/maps/Nuv5j)
markers.description: A new allotment project on University grounds, aiming to distribute half of the produce amongst volunteers and half to food outlets.The project is open to the local community as well as students and staff of the University of Sheffield
markers.title: Student Eats- University of Sheffield Community Allotments

markers.address: Shiregreen Neighbourhood Centre, Westnall Road, Shiregreen Sheffield S5 0AA
markers.description: The group meet on a weekly basis at Shiregreen Neighbourhood Centre, starting with a cuppa, then catching up on future activities and events, then get stuck into some gardening tasks. New members welcome.
markers.opening: Run sessions on Wednesdays between 10.30am and 4.00pm
markers.title: Shiregreen Garden Group

markers.address: Parson Cross Park, Off Buchanan Road, Parson Cross, Sheffield S5 8AL
markers.description: Community allotment project and shared polytunnel in Parson Cross Park. Plots of different sizes are available to local residents, free for the first year, and with free training and support available. Tools available to borrow.
markers.title: Parson Cross Family Community Garden

markers.address: Behind Yorkshire Artspace/Persistence Works and next to Radio Sheffield, along permissive footpath between Brown St and Shoreham St, S1 2BS
markers.description: A permanent Organic Ediculture installation, celebrating the growing process and living, edible art.
markers.title: Huerta Sheffield

markers.address: Off Morley St, Lower Walkley, Sheffield S6
markers.description: The Lower Walkley Community Group is managing abandoned former allotments on Morley Street for community use. The group is open to anyone with an interest in restoring derelict land in order to grow food and have space for recreation and wildlife.
markers.opening: Regular workday sessions. See the website, Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/LowerWalkleyCommunityGroup) or Twitter (https://twitter.com/LWCG_S6) for details
markers.title: Lower Walkley Community Garden

markers.address: Corner of Doncaster St and Matthew St, Shalesmoor, Sheffield
markers.description: A 3-year collaborative project to transform a disused urban wildscape into a curated space for the local community. Includes arts and growing activities.
markers.opening: Events and volunteer opportunities publicised on the website and social media: https://twitter.com/FurnacePark
markers.title: Furnace Park

markers.address: The Spires Centre, 600 East Bank Road, Arbourthorne, Sheffield S2 2AN
markers.description: A community allotment and garden at the back of the Spires Centre. Established by the Centre with Grow Sheffield, there are regular sessions for people to learn food growing and take some produce home.
markers.title: ARC – Community Allotment and Garden

markers.address: Thornbridge Brewery, Riverside Brewery, Buxton Road, Bakewell DE45 1GS
markers.description: Independent brewery near Bakewell. Brews a range of beers in cask, keg and bottle. Also own and run a series of Sheffield real-ale pubs and bars. Offers tours of the brewery every Wednesday at 3.00pm. Has a brewery shop and online shop.
markers.title: Thornbridge

markers.address: Nethercliffe Barn, Hill Top, Dungworth, Sheffield, South Yorkshire S6 6GW
markers.description: Artisan producer of premium quality local English honey and beeswax products. Available from farmers markets and local shops - see website for details.
markers.title: Sheffield Honey Company

markers.address: Cliffe Cottage, Hill Top Road, Dungworth, Sheffield S6 6GW
markers.description: Ice cream and milk products from own dairy herd. Available at on-site farm shop & ice cream parlour, or various businesses throughout Sheffield. Do not supply ice cream to supermarkets, preferring to support local businesses.
markers.opening: Farm shop and ice cream parlour: Wednesday, Friday, Saturday & Sunday, 11.00am - 6.00pm
markers.title: Our Cow Molly

markers.address: Rear of 36, Cat Lane, Sheffield S2 3AY
markers.description: Make bread using locally produced Stoneground flour and traditional long fermentation proccesses. A part of Sheffield Wholefoods (Beanies) - a workers co-operative. Bake bread in their premises in Heeley using predominantly stoneground flour from Mount Pleasant Windmill in Kirton-in-Lindsey, Lincolnshire.
markers.opening:
Bread sold at Beanies and throughout south and west Sheffield through a number of outlets with varying opening times. Check the website for 
details of stockists.
markers.title: Cat Lane Bakery

markers.address: Watt House Farm, High Bradfield, Sheffield, S6 6LG
markers.description: Bradfield Brewery is located on a busy working farm in the Peak District, producing a range of cask conditioned real ales using Peak Distict water from an on-site borehole. Bradfield produce six regular beers plus seasonal special brews, available from local pubs, and in bottle or mini-keg from the on-site brewery shop. Their brewery tap is the Nag's Head in Loxley.
markers.title: Bradfield Brewery

markers.address: Abbeydale Brewery Ltd, Unit 8, Aizlewood Road, Sheffield, S8 0YX
markers.description: Independent real ale brewer, producing a range of regular and seasonal beers in cask only. Their flagship beer, Moonshine, is available widely in Sheffield pubs; a full range is available from Abbeydale's pub, the Rising Sun in Nether Green.
markers.title: Abbeydale Brewery

markers.address: Kelham Island Brewery, 23 Alma Street, Sheffield, S3 8SA
markers.description: The oldest Sheffield brewery still in operatio. Kelham Island Brewery has been producing a selection of fine ales for over 25 years including Pale Rider which was voted Champion Beer of Britain 2004. Beer produced at the site is availble to the public in cask, minikeg, bottle or beer in a box from the brewery shop on Alma St, and from local pubs including the brewery tap - The Fat Cat. Kelham strives to produce greener beers by increasing efficiency and sustainable recycling.
markers.opening: Monday to Friday 8am - 3pm; Saturday 11am - 5pm; Sunday Closed
markers.title: Kelham Island Brewery

markers.address: Sheffield Brewery Company Limited, Unit 111, JC Albyn Complex, Burton Road, Sheffield S3 8BT
markers.description: Independent real ale brewery producing a range of regular and seasonal cask ales. Beers are available from the brewery tap, the Gardener's Rest in Neepsend, and other local real ale pubs. Also supply beer to parties and events. Takes bookings for brewery tours and parties throughout the year.
markers.opening: Brewery tours and parties by appointment.
markers.title: Sheffield Brewery Company

markers.address: Wortley Hall, Wortley, Sheffield, South Yorkshire, S35 7DB
markers.description: Organic kitchen garden run as a social enterprise by Heeley City Farm. Produces approx 4 tonnes of produce per year, supplying veg box schemes (Beanies, Regather), farm shops (New Roots, Wortley) and sold direct at Heeley City Farm and Nether Edge Farmers Market. Also runs training, educational visits and volunteering programmes.
markers.title: Wortley Hall Walled Garden

markers.address: Lightwood Lane, Sheffield, S8 8BG
markers.description: A cluster of independent organic growers, based on a 12-acre site in the Moss Valley. Sells produce through local independent shops including Beanies. Sharrow Marrow, Zeds, and runs a veg box scheme with Regather Co-operative.
markers.opening: Occasional open days and pick-your-own days. See website for details
markers.title: Sheffield Organic Growers

markers.address: The Old Tavern, Pog Lane, Sheffield S35 7AN
markers.description: Free-range pigs and chickens, reared in Crane Moor to the north of Sheffield. Sold direct to public or to restaurants/retailers. Pog Lane Produce's chickens have 24 hour access to pasture and stocking densities and flock size are strictly limited. Rare-breed Tamworth pigs are totally free range.
markers.opening: Available to order online or at farmer's markets, including Nether Edge, Hathersage and Penistone.
markers.title: Pog Lane Produce

markers.address: Round Green Deer Farm, Round Green Lane, Worsbrough, Barnsley, South Yorkshire, S75 3DR
markers.description: Venison farmer, butcher and farm shop with 30 year history. High animal welfare - all deer are free range, and an onsite butchers/abbatoir reduces stressful travel. Sells venison steaks, other venison products, and speciality meats on site, at local farmers markets, and to local businesses & restaurants.
markers.title: Round Green Farm

markers.address: Unit C, G4 Business Centre, Carlise Street East, Sheffield, S4 7QN
markers.description: Founded in 2007, The Brew Company is one of the newer independent breweries in Sheffield, producing a range of permanent and seasonal cask ales. Their brewery tap is the Harlequin, for which it produces two house beers, Blonde and Best Bitter. It also produces permanent house beers for the Devonshire Cat, The York and Riverside Live.
markers.title: The Brew Company

markers.address: Lu and Tom's house, Nether Edge. That's all you need to know.
markers.description: Lu and Tom have set up a craft brewery at their home in Nether Edge, from which they produce one-off small batch brews, which are available occasionally at local pubs such as the Broadfield and beer festivals. You can also order casks (35 pints) and pins (72 pints) for events and parties.
markers.title: On The Edge Brewery

markers.address: Unit 29-30, Hoyland Road Industrial Estate, Sheffield S3 8AB
markers.description: Richard set up Blue Bee Brewery after stints at Acorn Brewery and as Head Brewer at Abbeydale. Produces a series of regular cask ales (Nectar Pale, Bees Knees Bitter, Tangled Up IPA and Lustin' for Stout), as well as seasonal and one-off brews. Blue Bee beers are always on the bar at the Rutland Arms and regularly available at other real ale pubs across Sheffield.
markers.title: Blue Bee Brewery

markers.address: Unit 3, Aldham Industrial Estate, Mitchell Road, Wombwell, Barnsley S73 8HA
markers.description: Acorn produce a core range of ales and monthly specials, seasonal beers and occasional ales, including Barnsley Bitter, Barnsley Gold and Old Moor Porter. They use the same yeast strain as the original Barnsley Brewery, founded in the 1850s. Acorn run the Old No. 7 pub in Barnsley town centre, and their beers are widely available on cask across Barnsley and Sheffield. Their full range of bottled beers are now being stocked by the Rhythm & Booze chain of off licenses. Bottles and polypins available from the brewery shop.
markers.title: Acorn Brewery

markers.address: Little Ale Cart, The Wellington, 1 Henry Street, Sheffield S3 7EQ
markers.description: Dave and Gazza are hop fans. As Steel City Brewing, they brew one batch a month at Little Ale Cart in the Wellington, plus a variation in their own mini-kit. They plan to brew only one-off beers with no regular brews. Most brews are in the pale and hoppy 'mid-Atlantic' style. Beers are available in cask only from local pubs - the Rutland Arms and the Wellington being the most likely stockists.
markers.title: Steel City Brewing

markers.address: Mansfield Road, Aston, Rotherham S26 5PQ
markers.description: Family-run farmyard offering local produce including free-range eggs and outdoor reared, rare breed Berkshire/Saddleback pork. The family-friendly smallholding is open to visitors - you can feed the goats, pet Dolly the lamb or throw corn to the rare breed chickens. The farm also sells point of lay hens and all the equipment you’ll need to take good care of them.
markers.title: Aston Springs Farm

markers._d180g: Couldn't find actual location on Google or Bing maps
markers.address: Greenside Deli, Beighton Road, Hackenthorpe, Sheffield S12 4LQ
markers.description: A small family-run company specialising in handmade, traditionally produced preserves, chutneys and pickles. As far as possible, ingredients are locally sourced. Products can be purchased via the website or found at local farmers markets.
markers.title: Greenside Deli

markers.address: 105 Ecclesall Road South, Sheffield S11 9PH
markers.description: A specialist cheese shop offering approximately 70 different cheeses, including local varieties such as Derbyshire Peakland blue, Yorkshire Blue and Peakland White.
markers.title: Silver Hill Larder

markers.address: Works 57, 57 Chippinghouse Road, Sheffield S8 0ZF
markers.description: Jams and chutneys made in Sheffield by hand. Sold at local shops, cafes and delis - see http://www.justpreserves.co.uk/products.html for details.
markers.title: Just Preserves

markers.address: Wadsley Hall Farm Kitchen, Far Lane, Sheffield, S6 4FD
markers.description: Hand-crafted fruit cakes made by Jane Stammers using local ingredients: free range eggs laid a couple of miles up the road at Stacey Bank, butter from Holmfirth, and flour from Driffield millers, Bradshaws. Buy from the website or local stockists including The Schoolrooms, Birds Yard, Marmadukes.
markers.title: Tipple Tails

markers.address: Povey Farm, Lightwood Lane, Sheffield S8 8BG
markers.description: Supplying pork produce to local restaurants, cafes and delicatessens.
markers.title: Moss Valley Fine Meats

markers.address: The Roastery, 15 E&F Tinsley Industrial Estate, Shepcote Lane, Sheffield, S9 1TL
markers.description: Wholesale coffee roasters and suppliers to cafes, restaurants, bars and coffee shops. Work closely with coffee plantations in India, and make every effort to look after the pickers and planters while they are working and after they retire. Also buy Fairtrade and Rainforest Alliance approved beans.
markers.title: Pollards

markers.address: Hendersons (Sheffield) Ltd., Leavygreave Road, Sheffield S3 7RA
markers.description: "The spicy Yorkshire sauce", Hendersons has been produced in Sheffield since the late 19th century. Unlike Worcestershire sauce, Hendersons is vegetarian and vegan. Available widely from shops, supermarkets, cafes, etc., or can be ordered via the website.
markers.title: Hendersons Relish

markers.address: 2a Waleswood Industrial Estate, Wales Bar, Sheffield S26 5PY
markers.description: Produce hand cooked crisps using potatoes and parsnips grown by local farmers within a few miles of Wales Bar. No MSG, preservatives, colourings or artificial flavours are used. All packaging sourced from Yorkshire suppliers. Available fairly widely in cafes, pubs, farm shops, and some supermarkets.
markers.title: Yorkshire Crisps

markers.address: 16 Edgedale Road,  Sheffield S7 2BQ
markers.description: Jams, jellies, marmalades, chutneys and pickles hand-made using fruit collected from hedgerows, grown on the allotment, or sourced locally.  Make small batches using traditional preserving techniques, trying not to use pectin other than that found in the fruit itself. Available at farmers markets, festivals and Porter Brook Deli.
markers.title: The Hedgerow Preserving Company

markers.address: Next to Holberry Playground, off Hanover St, Sheffield S3
markers.description: Community allotment with raised beds and a greenhouse. Established by Hanover Tenants Association open to the people of Broomhall. If you would like to get involved, call round on most Saturdays or Sundays and have a word with John Cawthorne, who will be able to tell you if there are any plots free and advise on what help is needed.
markers.opening: Saturdays and Sundays to meet the organisers.
markers.title: Jubilee Allotment

markers.address: Various venues around Broomhall
markers.description: Community organisation which aims to improve and regenerate the Broomhall area using community growing. Activities include container & hanging basket planting in public areas, creating a community garden alongside the Broomhall Centre, and developing the community orchard on the corner of Holberry Gardens and Havelock Street.
markers.title: Helping Environmental Regeneration in Broomhall

markers.address: 57-59 Club Garden Road, Sheffield S11 8BU
markers.description: Organic veg box scheme supplied and run by Full Circe Farm, one of the members of Sheffield Organic Growers in Moss Valley.
markers.opening: Order on the website or call in to Regather.
markers.title: Regather Co-operative Veg Box Scheme

markers.address: between Ladycroft stream/bridge and Bowling Greens, Ecclesfield Park
markers.description: Community garden run by the Revitalising Ecclesfield Park and Pavilion Group. Welcomes volunteers to help with park activities or to work in the community garden.
markers.title: Ecclesfield Park Community Garden
